page.title: 03POPULATION AND EMPLOYMENT
page.content: 375 adults and 82 children live in our area. Ofthe adults 94 are retired, 58 are housewives, 12 are unemployed and 3 too ill to work. Of the 167 in work, 33 are farmers, 29 work at the Blue Circle Cement Works at Eastgate, 8 at Weardale Minerals at Blackdene, 7 in road haulage and 7 in mines outside the area. There are 7 nurses, 6 teachers, 4 secretaries and 2 university students. 3 work for the Northumbrian Water Authority and 5 in the Filter House at Burnhope. 15 work in shops and 10 in catering. Several are self-employed, including a potter and 2 weavers. At least 2 work abroad. Of the 82 children, 17 are under school age, 27 attend primary school at St. John's Chapel or Wearhead and 38 travel to Wolsingham Comprehensive School.
